task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 129°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade and roofline of the main building to estimate height, so I'll tilt up while keeping the same heading.
I’m no longer facing the target SE building (I’m at 0°), so I should rotate to ~129° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline for a height estimate.
To estimate the building height I need the roofline and base in view, so I’ll tilt up to include the top of the main facade.
The view has reset to 0° again, so I need to rotate back to ~129° while keeping the 30° upward pitch to see the building top for height estimation.
I should stop rotating and instead provide an estimate of the main building height from ground to roof, using visible storeys as a scale.
